content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to perform this task:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"\s|-"=> "_")
end
```
This function takes a column name (`col`) as input, converts it into lower case and strips leading/trailing whitespaces. Then, replace any spaces or hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function. The `r"\s|-"` part of the regular expression denotes that all spaces and hyphens should be replaced by an underscore.
